intro: Caladenia parva, commonly known as the small spider orchid, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that resemble spiders. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowering period occurs during late winter to early spring, producing pink or purple blooms. Caladenia parva is also known for its unique pollination mechanism, attracting specific insect pollinators through its specialized floral structure.
